pitch: What begins as an enquiry on things that mean other things itself becomes a thing that means other things, too. And whatever exactly that thing is, the latest by one of Canada’s most ingenious auteurs is another astounding feat of cerebral and cinephilic dexterity.
cast: Clare Coulter,  Robin Benger

name: The Big Bad Fox & Other Tales
pitch: Filmmaker, animator and cartoonist Benjamin Renner (Ernest & Celestine) adapts his own comic strips for this trio of laugh-out-loud animal adventures.
producers: Didier Brunner,  Damien Brunner,  Vincent Tavier
cast: Céline Ronté,  Boris Rehlinger,  Guillaume Bouchede,  Guillaume Darnault,  Magali Rosenzweig,  Elise Noiraud,  Jules Bienvenu

name: The Brawler
pitch: A lower-caste boxer struggles to make his mark on the boxing world, in the highly anticipated film from Anurag Kashyap.
producers: Aanand L. Rai,  Vikramaditya Motwane,  Madhu Mantena,  Anurag Kashyap
cinematographers: Rajeev Ravi,  Shanker Raman,  Jay Patel,  Jayesh Nair
cast: Vineet Kumar Singh,  Zoya Hussain,  Ravi Kissan,  Jimmy Shergill,  Sadhana Singh

name: The Breadwinner
pitch: Based on Deborah Ellis’ award-winning novel, director Nora Twomey’s The Breadwinner tells the extraordinary story of an 11-year-old Afghan girl who finds strength in the love of her family and the power of storytelling.
producers: Anthony Leo,  Andrew Rosen,  Paul Young,  Tomm Moore,  Stephan Roelants
cast: Saara Chaudry,  Soma Chhaya,  Laara Sadiq,  Shaista Latif,  Ali Badshah,  Kawa Ada,  Noorin Gulamgaus

name: The Burden
pitch: In this comically acerbic musical epic, the animal occupants of a generic shopping plaza next to a freeway sing out their existential angst — doomed by the apocalyptic banality of subsistence in the modern age.
cast: Carl Englén,  Olof Wretling,  Sven Björklund,  Mattias Fransson

name: The Captain
pitch: Director Robert Schwentke (The Time Traveler’s Wife, RED, Insurgent) returned to his native Germany to make this stunning black-and-white war movie, which follows a young German deserter as he tries to survive in the deadly final days of the Third Reich.
producers: Frieder Schlaich,  Irene  von Alberti,  Piotr Dzieciol,  Ewa Puszczynska Lakowa
cast: Max Hubacher,  Milan Peschel,  Frederick Lau,  Alexander Fehling

name: The Carter Effect
pitch: In his latest documentary, Sean Menard gives viewers an unprecedented look at Vince Carter: the six-foot-six, eight-time NBA All-Star from Daytona Beach who made waves in the Canadian basketball scene when he joined the Raptors in 1998.
cast: Vince Carter,  Drake,  David Stern,  Tracy McGrady,  Michelle Carter-Scott

name: The Children Act
pitch: Emma Thompson and Stanley Tucci star in this adaptation of the novel by Ian McEwan, about a high-court judge (Thompson) who finds personal and professional crises colliding when she is asked to rule in the case of a brilliant 18-year-old boy who is refusing the blood transfusion that would save his life.
cast: Emma Thompson,  Stanley Tucci,  Fionn Whitehead

name: The China Hustle
pitch: An unsettling and eye-opening Wall Street horror story about Chinese companies, the American stock market, and the opportunistic greed behind the biggest heist you’ve never heard of.

name: The Conformist
pitch: A police informant in a town on the Sino-Russian border finds his double life catching up with him, in director Cai Shangjun’s combination of crime movie and character study.
production: Fangjin Visual Media Culture Communication (Beijing) Co.
cast: Huang Bo,  Song Jia

name: The Crescent
pitch: The trio behind 2012’s fever dream–like Lowlife return with a hallucinatory story focused on a woman and her child enveloped by creeping dread upon retreating to a remote coastal estate.
cast: Danika Vandersteen,  Woodrow Graves,  Terrance Murray,  Brit Loder,  Andrew Gillis

name: The Crying Conch
pitch: The true history of the leader of an 18th century slave rebellion in Haiti is transformed into the stuff of myth and ritual in a visually sumptuous effort by Canada’s Vincent Toi, connecting the brutality of our colonial past with the resilience of the present.
producers: Guillaume Collin,  Vincent Toi,  Charles Jonas
cast: Ebby Angel Louis,  Zidor Montal

name: The Cured
pitch: Ellen Page stars in this gloriously terrifying yet thought-provoking horror thriller about the fraught process of reintegrating formerly infected flesh-eaters into society in the aftermath of a zombie plague.
producers: Rachael O'Kane,  Rory Dungan,  Ellen Page
cast: Ellen Page,  Sam Keeley,  Tom Vaughan-Lawlor

name: The Current War
pitch: Alfonso Gomez-Rejon (Me and Earl and the Dying Girl) directs Benedict Cumberbatch, Michael Shannon, Nicholas Hoult, Tom Holland, and Katherine Waterston in this account of the race for marketable electricity in the United States between Thomas Edison and George Westinghouse.
producers: Harvey Weinstein,  Basil Iwaynk,  Timur Bekmambetov
cast: Benedict Cumberbatch,  Michael Shannon,  Nicholas Hoult,  Tom Holland,  Katherine Waterston,  Tuppence Middleton,  Matthew Macfadyen

name: The Day After
pitch: Prolific Korean master Hong Sangsoo’s conversational comedy of errors intertwines the stories of an unfaithful publishing company manager and his new assistant, whom his wife mistakes as his former lover.
cast: Kwon Haehyo,  Kim Minhee,  Kim Saebyuk,  Cho Yunhee,  Ki Jubong,  Park Yeaju,  Kang Taeu

name: The Death of Stalin
pitch: Armando Iannucci (Veep) directs Jeffrey Tambor, Steve Buscemi, and Andrea Riseborough in this acerbic send-up of the Soviet dictator and the bootlick Ministers who vie for power after his sudden demise
producers: Yann Zenou,  Laurent Zeitoun,  Nicolas Duval Adassovsky,  Kevin Loader
cast: Steve Buscemi,  Simon Russell Beale,  Paddy Considine,  Rupert Friend,  Jason Isaacs,  Olga Kurylenko,  Michael Palin,  Andrea Riseborough,  Paul Chahidi,  Dermot Crowley,  Adrian McLoughlin,  Paul Whitehouse,  Jeffrey Tambor

name: The Death, Dad & Son
pitch: In the latest by one of the most talented teams in the worlds of comics and animation, Death is reimagined as a devoted family man whose son doesn’t entirely understand his family’s role in the grand scheme of things. As Dad tends to his duties, the boy performs a series of well-meaning acts with hilariously disastrous consequences.
producers: Marc Jousset,  Perrine Capron,  Ruby Thibault

name: The Deuce
pitch: From the creative minds behind The Wire and Treme comes this gritty snapshot into the birth of the porn industry in 1970s New York, starring James Franco and Maggie Gyllenhaal.
cinematographers: Pepe Avila del Pino,  Vanja Cernjul
cast: James Franco,  Maggie Gyllenhaal,  Gary Carr,  Margarita Levieva,  Lawrence Gilliard,  Jr.,  Dominique Fishback,  Emily Meade,  Gbenga Akinnagbe,  Chris Bauer,  Natalie Paul,  Chris Coy,  Michael Rispoli

name: The Disaster Artist
pitch: James Franco directs this giddy tribute to eccentric filmmaker Tommy Wiseau and his friend, actor Greg Sestero, whose notoriously awful film The Room has become one of the most beloved cult classics of all time.
producers: Vince Jolivette,  James Franco,  Seth Rogen,  James Weaver,  Evan Goldberg
cast: Dave Franco,  James Franco,  Seth Rogen,  Ari Graynor,  Alison Brie,  Jacki Weaver,  Paul Scheer,  Josh Hutcherson,  Zac Efron

name: The Drop In
pitch: On a night like any other, Joelle is closing up her hair salon when a mysterious visitor appears asking too many questions about her citizenship. Nothing is what it seems in this fierce and stylish genre-bending allegory on immigration and belonging.
cast: Mouna Traoré,  Oluniké Adeliyi

name: The Escape
pitch: Gemma Arterton stars as a housewife and mother suffocating under the weight of her domestic burdens who makes the extraordinary decision to abandon her family in order to find herself.
cast: Gemma Arterton,  Dominic Cooper,  Jalil Lespert,  Frances Barber,  Marthe Keller

name: The Final Year
pitch: Greg Barker gives an unprecedented look at the shaping of US foreign policy by following key members of outgoing US President Barack Obama’s administration.
producers: Julie Goldman,  John Battsek,  Greg Barker
cast: Samantha Power,  John Kerry,  Ben Rhodes,  Susan Rice,  Barack Obama

name: The Florida Project
pitch: The latest from Sean Baker (Tangerine) juxtaposes the carefree summer of a spirited kid with the harsh realities dogging the grown-ups in her orbit.
producers: Sean Baker,  Chris Bergoch,  Kevin Chinoy,  Andrew Duncan,  Alex Saks,  Francesca Silvestri,  Shih-Ching Tsou
cast: Willem Dafoe,  Brooklynn Prince,  Bria Vinaite,  Valeria Cotto

name: The Girlfriend Experience Season 2
pitch: The second season of Starz's chilling serialized drama — about highly paid sex workers who provide their clients with the full sexual and emotional girlfriend experience — focuses on the lives of Anna, caught up in the corrupt world of Washington politics, and Bria, an ex-sex worker in hiding who can’t escape her past.
cast: Carmen Ejogo,  Louisa Krause,  Anna Friel

name: The Gospel According to André
pitch: From the segregated American South to the fashion capitals of the world, operatic fashion editor André Leon Talley's life and career are on full display, in a poignant portrait that includes appearances by Anna Wintour, Marc Jacobs, Tom Ford, Bethann Hardison, Valentino, and Manolo Blahnik.
cast: André Leon Talley,  Anna Wintour,  Marc Jacobs,  Whoopi Goldberg,  Tom Ford,  Bethann Hardison,  Diane von Furstenberg,  Manolo Blahnik,  Tamron Hall

name: The Guardians
pitch: French director Xavier Beauvois’ intimate drama explores the lives of women who are left behind to work a family farm during the Great War.
cast: Nathalie Baye,  Laura Smet,  Iris Bry,  Cyril Descours,  Gilbert Bonneau,  Olivier Rabourdin,  Nicolas Giraud,  Mathilde Viseux-Ely

name: The House by the Sea
pitch: Three grown children gathered at the picturesque villa of their dying father reflect on where they are, who they have become, and what they have inherited, in Robert Guédiguian’s elegiac tribute to a family and a fading lifestyle.
cast: Ariane Ascaride,  Jean-Pierre Darroussin,  Gérard Meylan,  Jacques Boudet,  Anaïs Demoustier,  Robinson Stévenin,  Yann Tregouët,  Geneviève Mnich,  Fred Ulysse,  Diouc Koma

name: The Hungry
pitch: Writer-director Bornila Chatterjee relocates Shakespeare's bloody tragedy Titus Andronicus to modern-day India, where corruption, greed, and revenge run rampant at an extravagant wedding.
cast: Naseeruddin Shah,  Tisca Chopra,  Neeraj  Kabi,  Arjun Gupta,  Sayani,  Suraj Sharma,  Antonio Aakeel,  Karan Pandit,  Savita Rani,  Jayant Kripalani

name: The Insult
pitch: A dispute between two men — one Christian, one Palestinian — on the streets of Beirut becomes a national sensation when it opens up old wounds and traumatic memories.
cast: Adel Karam,  Kamel El Basha,  Camille Salameh,  Diamand Abou Abboud,  Rita Hayek

name: The Journey
pitch: Iraqi-Dutch filmmaker Mohamed Al-Daradji returns to the Festival with this tense and provocative political meditation about a would-be suicide bomber and the fast-talking train station attendant she takes hostage.
producers: Isabelle Stead,  Mohamed Jabarah Al-daradji,  Hélène Cases
editors: Mohamed Jabarah Al-daradji,  Pascale Chavance,  Herve De Luz
cast: Zahraa Ghandour,  Ameer Ali Jabarah

name: The Judge
pitch: A vérité legal drama about Judge Kholoud Al-Faqih, the first woman appointed to a Shari’a court in the Middle East, whose career provides rare insights into both Islamic law and gendered justice.
cast: Judge Kholoud Al-Faqih

name: The Killing of a Sacred Deer
pitch: The strange relationship between a cardiac surgeon and a 16-year-old boy portends a terrifying sacrifice, in this eagerly awaited supernatural thriller from Yorgos Lanthimos (The Lobster) starring Colin Farrell, Nicole Kidman, and Alicia Silverstone.

name: The Legend of the Ugly King
pitch: Director Hüseyin Tabak explores the legacy of Yilmaz Güney — political dissident, convicted murderer, and visionary Kurdish filmmaker — who directed the 1982 Palme d'Or–winning Yol from inside prison and died in exile just two years later.
cast: Yilmaz Güney,  Hüseyin Tabak,  Michael Haneke,  Costa Gavras,  Gilles Jacob,  Elif Güney Pütün,  Fatos Güney,  Tarik Akan,  Tuncel Kurtiz,  Donat Keusch,  Leyla Demirezen,  Güllü Pütün,  Jack Lang,  Nebahat Cehre,  Halil Ergün

name: The Leisure Seeker
pitch: Oscar winner Helen Mirren and Donald Sutherland star as an elderly couple looking for adventure on one boisterous and bittersweet final road trip.
producers: Fabrizio Donvito,  Marco Cohen,  Benedetto Habib
cast: Helen Mirren,  Donald Sutherland,  Christian Mckay,  Janel Moloney,  Dana Ivey

name: The Little Girl Who Was Too Fond of Matches
pitch: The latest by Québecois auteur Simon Lavoie (Those Who Make Revolution Halfway Only Dig Their Own Graves) follows the lives of two children who, in the wake of their father’s death, gradually come to realize the perverse nature of their upbringing.
cast: Marine Johnson,  Antoine L'Écuyer,  Jean-François Casabonne

name: The Lodgers
pitch: Set in rural Ireland in 1920, this Gothic chiller evokes the spooky stories of Shirley Jackson and Oscar Wilde in its tale of teenage twins living in a haunted manor under the shadow of a family curse.
cast: Charlotte Vega,  Bill Milner,  Eugene Simon,  David Bradley,  Moe Dunford,  Deirdre O'Kane

name: The Motive
pitch: Searching for literary inspiration, an aspiring novelist in Seville insinuates himself into the lives of his apartment-dwelling neighbours and attempts to instigate drama, in this hilarious, thought-provoking, and self-aware meditation on art and authorial intent.
producers: Manuel Martín Cuenca,  Alejandro Hernández,  Gonzalo Salazar-Simpson,  David Naranjo,  Jose Nolla,  Alex Zito,  Mónica Lozano
cast: Javier Gutiérrez,  María León,  Adelfa Calvo,  Adriana Paz,  Tenoch Huerta,  Rafael Tellez,  Antonio de la Torre

name: The Mountain Between Us
pitch: A surgeon (Idris Elba) and a journalist (Kate Winslet) must rely on each other for survival when the small plane they share crashes in the wilderness.
cast: Kate Winslet,  Idris Elba,  Beau Bridges,  Dermot Mulroney

name: The Nothing Factory
pitch: This elegiac epic from Portuguese filmmaker Pedro Pinho chronicles a bitter labour dispute sparked by the closure of a factory on the outskirts of Lisbon.
producers: João Matos,  Leonor Noivo,  Luísa Homem,  Pedro Pinho,  Susana Nobre,  Tiago Hespanha
editors: Luísa Homem,  Cláudia Oliveira,  Edgar Feldman
cast: José Smith Vargas,  Carla Galvão,  Njamy Sebastião,  Joaquim Bichana Martins,  Daniel Incalcaterra,  Rui Ruivo,  Hermínio Amaro,  António Santos

name: The Number
pitch: In this harrowing, based-on-fact story about South Africa’s most dangerous and notorious prison gang, a high-echelon gang member begins to question his allegiance to his "family" after a young recruit is brutally killed.
editors: Megan Gill,  Ronelle Loots,  Nick Costaras
cast: Mothusi Magano,  Kevin Smith,  Warren Masemola,  Presley Chweneyagae,  Deon Lotz,  Lemo Tsipa,  Charlton George

name: The Other Side Of Everything
pitch: For Serbian filmmaker Mila Turajlic, a locked door in her mother’s apartment in Belgrade provides the gateway to both her remarkable family history and her country’s tumultuous political inheritance.

name: The Other Side of Hope
pitch: A failing restaurant owner hires a young Syrian refugee he finds sleeping in the inner yard of the restaurant, in this Silver Bear–winning dramedy from acclaimed Finnish director Aki Kaurismäki.
cast: Sherwan Haji,  Sakari Kuosmanen,  Ilkka Koivula,  Janne Hyytiäinen,  Nuppu Koivu,  Kaija Pakarinen,  Niroz Haji,  Simon Hussein Al-Bazoon

name: The President's Visit
pitch: In a sleepy seaside community in Lebanon, a soap maker receives word that the President intends to visit and the over-zealous townsfolk scramble to construct an image of themselves that is worthy of the stately occasion. This delightful comedy is richly shaded by the whimsical eccentricities of the village population.
cast: Fouad Yammine

name: The Price of Success
pitch: A popular stand-up comic from a working class French family balances fame, ambition, and expectations while feeling his loyalties pulled between his manager-brother and artistic-director girlfriend.
cast: Tahar Rahim,  Roschdy Zem,  Maïwenn

name: The Rider
pitch: Chloé Zhao’s (Songs My Brothers Taught Me) Art Cinema Award–winning impressionistic drama casts real-life wrangler Brady Jandreau as a South Dakota cowboy struggling to chart a new course.
producers: Bert Hamelinck,  Sacha Ben Harroche,  Mollye Asher
cast: Brady Jandreau,  Lane Scott,  Cat Clifford,  Lilly Jandreau,  Tim Jandreau

name: The Ritual
pitch: Venturing into the wilderness of the Swedish highlands to perform a remembrance for a dearly departed friend, four men are subjected to a night of terror when they unwisely take refuge in a derelict house.
cast: Rafe Spall,  Arsher Ali,  Robert James-Collier,  Sam Troughton

name: The Royal Hibiscus Hotel
pitch: In this spritely Nollywood romantic comedy, an aspiring restaurateur returns to her home in Lagos to try and refine the fare at her family’s little hotel, only to find that her parents are planning on selling out to a rich (and devilishly attractive) buyer.
cast: Zainab Balogun,  Kenneth Okolie,  Jide Kosoko,  Rachel Oniga,  Deyemi Okanlawon,  Kemi 'Lala' Akindoju,  OC Ukeje,  Joke Silva,  Olu Jacobs,  Toni Tones,  Ini Dima-Okojie,  Akah Nnani,  Charles Inojie

name: The Seen and Unseen
pitch: A 10-year-old girl retreats to a fantastical, evocative dream space to deal with the impending loss of her twin brother, in this imaginative film from Indonesian director Kamila Andini.
producers: Kamila Andini,  Ifa Isfansyah,  Gita Fara
cast: Thaly Titi Kasih,  Gus Sena,  Ayu Laksmi,  I Ketut Rina,  Happy Salma

name: The Shape of Water
pitch: At the height of the Cold War, circa 1962, two workers in a high-tech US government laboratory (Sally Hawkins and Oscar winner Octavia Spencer) discover a terrifying secret experiment, in this otherworldly fairytale from Guillermo del Toro (Pan’s Labyrinth).
producers: Guillermo del Toro,  J. Miles Dale
cast: Sally Hawkins,  Michael Shannon,  Richard Jenkins,  Doug Jones,  Michael Stuhlbarg,  Octavia Spencer

name: The Square
pitch: Swedish provocateur Ruben Östlund (Force Majeure) took home the Palme d’Or at Cannes for this no-holds-barred satire of the postmodern art world, about a self-important curator whose attempts to mount an ambitious exhibition go hilariously awry.
cast: Claes Bang,  Elisabeth Moss,  Dominic West,  Terry Notary,  Christopher Læssø

name: The Summit
pitch: In this incisive political drama from Argentinean director Santiago Mitre (The Student), the newly sworn-in Argentine president faces a formidable challenge when geopolitical wheeling-dealing and backstage family issues collide at a South American oil-trade summit.
producers: Hugo Sigman,  Fernando Bovaira,  Matias Mosteirin,  Didar Domehri,  Simón de Santiago,  Fernando Brom,  Agustina Llambi Campbell,  Leticia Cristi,  Axel Kuschevatzky
cast: Ricardo Darin,  Dolores Fonzi,  Érica Rivas,  Elena Anaya,  Daniel Giménez Cacho,  Alfredo Castro,  Leonardo Franco,  Paula García,  Christian Slater

name: The Sweater
pitch: In this classic animation adapted from Roch Carrier's beloved storybook, the famed Quebec writer recounts a childhood memory of having to face his friends — all diehard Montreal Canadiens fans — in a (gulp!) Maple Leafs jersey!

name: The Tesla World Light
pitch: In New York in 1905, the world’s greatest inventor ponders a revolutionary new concept of electricity while diving ever-deeper into a romantic fantasy about a feathery visitor to his windowsill. The intensity of Tesla’s ideas and feelings generate a moment so charged that the images in Matthew Rankin’s astounding live-action/animation hybrid explode off the screen.
cast: Robert Vilar

name: The Third Murder
pitch: Festival favourite Hirokazu Kore-eda (Still Walking, Nobody Knows) takes a fascinating left turn with this intricate murder mystery, about a defense attorney who believes that his client — the self-confessed killer of a wealthy industrialist — is the fall guy for a sinister conspiracy.
cast: Masaharu Fukuyama,  Koji Yakusho,  Suzu Hirose

name: The Treehouse
pitch: A fiery young couple may be as hot for each other as they are ill-suited. Bold and sexy, Treehouse is an astonishingly astute look at the stormy passions and knotty intensity that make some relationships alluring to the point of being unbearable.
producers: Capucine Mahé,  Franco Lolli,  Melissa Malinbaum
cast: Luna Acosta,  Juan Lugo Quebrada

name: The Upside
pitch: Bryan Cranston and Kevin Hart star in this remake of the French hit The Intouchables, a dramatic buddy comedy about the unlikely friendship between a rich quadriplegic and his working-class caregiver.
producers: Jason Blumenthal,  Todd Black,  Steve Tisch
cast: Bryan Cranston,  Kevin Hart,  Nicole Kidman,  Julianna Margulies,  Aja Naomi King,  Golshifteh Farahani

name: The Watchmen
pitch: In The Watchmen, pulsating orbs, panopticons, roadside rest stops, and subterranean labyrinths confront the scope of human consequences and the entanglement of our seeking bodies.

name: The Wife
pitch: Jonathan Pryce, Glenn Close, and Christian Slater star in Björn Runge's adaptation of Meg Wolitzer's bestselling novel about a woman (Close) who decides to leave her author husband (Pryce) on the eve of his Nobel Prize presentation in order to finally pursue her own writing aspirations.
producers: Rosalie Swedlin,  Meta Louise Foldager Sørenson,  Piers Tempest,  Jo Bamford,  Claudia Bluemhuber,  Piodor Gustafsson
cast: Glenn Close,  Jonathan Pryce,  Christian Slater,  Max Irons,  Harry Lloyd,  Annie Starke

name: Thelma
pitch: Recently moved to Oslo to attend school, a young woman falls in love and discovers that she possesses terrifying powers, in this supernatural thriller from acclaimed director Joachim Trier (Louder Than Bombs).
cast: Eili Harboe,  Kaya Wilkins,  Ellen Dorrit Petersen,  Henrik Rafaelsen

name: There is a House Here
pitch: Spanning years of correspondence and three separate trips to Nunavut, Alan Zweig's latest documentary navigates issues of culture and identity with his pen-pal and semi-reluctant guide, Tatanniq Idlout, a.k.a. Inuk rock singer Lucie Idlout.
producers: Michael McMahon,  Kristina McLaughlin,  Kevin McMahon
cast: Tatanniq Idlout

name: Threads
pitch: In this spellbinding hand-drawn odyssey by the celebrated Oscar-winning animator Torill Kove, a bustling urban habitat becomes an enchanting web of human connection. Threads explores how fundamental attachment is to the experience of being human.
producers: Lise Fearnley,  Tonje Skar Reiersen,  Michael Fukushima

name: Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri
pitch: A frustrated and grieving mother (Frances McDormand) antagonizes her local police force (including Woody Harrelson and Sam Rockwell) to call attention to the lack of progress in the search for her daughter’s killer, in the latest from dark-humour master Martin McDonagh.
producers: Graham Broadbent,  Pete Czernin,  Martin McDonagh
cast: Frances McDormand,  Woody Harrelson,  Sam Rockwell,  Abbie Cornish,  Lucas Hedges,  Željko Ivanek,  Caleb Landry Jones,  Clarke Peters,  Samara Weaving,  John Hawkes,  Peter Dinklage

name: Three Christs
pitch: In this dark comedy from producer-director Jon Avnet, Dr. Alan Stone (Richard Gere) breaks new ground for treatment of the mentally ill through an experiment on three paranoid schizophrenic patients (Peter Dinklage, Bradley Whitford, Walton Goggins) who believe they are Jesus Christ.
producers: Daniel Levin,  Molly Hassell,  Jon Avnet,  Dr. Aaron Stern
cast: Richard Gere,  Peter Dinklage,  Walton Goggins,  Bradley Whitford,  Charlotte Hope,  Julianna Margulies,  Jane Alexander,  Kevin Pollak,  Stephen Root

name: Three Peaks
pitch: Bérénice Bejo (The Artist, The Search) stars in this slow-burning study of a couple whose log-cabin vacation with their young son takes on ominous tones as the boy’s subtle acts of rebellion gradually escalate toward a chilling climax.
producers: Benny Drechsel,  Andreas Pichler,  Philipp Moravetz
cast: Alexander Fehling,  Bérénice Bejo,  Arian Montgomery

name: Ticino
pitch: A silent, black and white film portrait of two children set against the eponymous Swiss river, Ticino takes its cue from Franz West's famous "Adaptives" sculptures.

name: Together Alone
pitch: In this strikingly intimate portrait of two siblings, Débora is deaf and inseparable from her protective older brother Facundo — but a potential change in their circumstances is on the horizon. Director Mateo Bendesky explores how the burden of being needed is not so easy to let go of.
cast: Vicente Correa,  Lucrecia Garrido,  Mónica Raiola,  Claudio Rangnau

name: Tulipani, Love, Honour and a Bicycle
pitch: In this wonderfully wooly tale about rediscovering one’s roots, a young Montrealer arrives in a small Italian village to scatter her mother’s ashes, and finds herself embroiled in a bizarre series of family histories and feuds.
producers: Hans de Weers,  Elwin Looije,  Don Carmody,  David Cormican,  Corrado Azzollini,  Claudio Bucci
cast: Ksenia Solo,  Giancarlo Giannini,  Gijs Naber,  Lidia Vitale,  Donatella Finocchiaro,  Georgio Pasotti,  Michele Venitucci,  Anneke Sluiters,  Totò Onnis

name: Turtles Are Always Home
pitch: Rawane Nassif uses the Qanat Quartier of Doha, Qatar — with its faux-Venetian canals and façades — as a starting point for an abstract reflection on the concepts of place, authenticity, and home.
cast: Rawane Nassif

name: Under Pressure
pitch: Adapted by Jorge Furtado and Andrucha Waddington from the latter's 2016 film, Under Pressure is a character-driven medical drama set in an underfunded public hospital in a poverty-stricken Rio de Janeiro favela.
producers: Andrucha Waddington,  Gustavo Baldoni,  Ana Gabriela,  Maria Amélia Teixeira,  Renata Brandão
editors: Sergio Mekler,  Moema Pombo,  Thiago Lima
cast: Julio Andrade,  Marjorie Estiano,  Stepan Nercessian,  Orã Figueiredo,  Pablo Sanábio,  Bruno Garcia

name: Under the Tree
pitch: The shade from a front-yard tree brings the already simmering tensions between two families in an Icelandic suburb to boiling point, in this hilariously absurd and psychologically astute comedy from director Hafsteinn Gunnar Sigurðsson.
producers: Grímar Jónsson,  Sindri Páll Kjartansson,  Þórir Snær Sigurjónsson,  Caroline Schlüter Bingestam,  Ditte Milsted,  Jacob Jarek,  Klaudia Smieja,  Beata Rzezniczek,  Jamila Wenske,  Sol Bondy
cast: Steinþór Hróar Steinþórsson,  Edda Björgvinsdóttir,  Sigurður Sigurjónsson,  Lára Jóhanna Jónsdóttir,  Þorsteinn Bachmann,  Selma Björnsdóttir,  Dóra Jóhannsdóttir,  Sigríður Sigurpálsdóttir Scheving

name: Unicorn Store
pitch: Brie Larson stars in her directorial debut about a dreamer reluctant to abandon her childish wonder who is offered the most magical gift she can imagine, with Samuel L. Jackson, Joan Cusack, and Bradley Whitford.
producers: David Bernad,  Ruben Fleischer,  Lynette Howell Taylor,  Brie Larson,  Paris Kasidokostas-Latsis,  Terry Dougas
cast: Brie Larson,  Samuel L. Jackson,  Joan Cusack,  Bradley Whitford,  Mamoudou Athie,  Hamish Linklater,  Martha MacIsaac,  Karan Soni,  Annaleigh Ashford

name: Vampire Clay
pitch: Japanese director and master makeup artist Soichi Umezawa gives life to a plasticine demon that subsequently devours the denizens of a rural art school.
producers: Yukihiko Yamaguchi,  Soîchi Umezawa,  Yoshihiro Nishimura
cast: Kyoka Takeda,  Momoka Sugimoto,  Ena Fujita,  Yuyu Makihara,  Asuka Kurosawa

name: Veronica
pitch: Inspired by real events that transpired in Madrid in 1991, the nerve-rattling new feature from Spanish director Paco Plaza (co-creator of the hugely successful [REC] series) chronicles a teenage girl’s descent into terror following her naïve attempt to communicate with her dead father.
cast: Sandra Escacena,  Bruna González,  Claudia Placer,  Iván Chavero,  Consuelo Trujillo,  Ana Torrent

name: Victoria & Abdul
pitch: Acclaimed British auteur Stephen Frears reunites with his Philomena star, Academy Award winner Judi Dench, in this charming dramedy chronicling the friendship between Queen Victoria and a decades-younger Indian clerk named Abdul Karim.
producers: Tim Bevan,  Eric Fellner,  Beeban Kidron,  Tracey Seaward
cast: Judi Dench,  Ali Fazal,  Eddie Izzard,  Tim Piggot-Smith,  Olivia Williams,  Adeel Akhtar,  Fenella Woolgar

name: Waiting
pitch: Two boys loiter outside their neighbourhood corner store, waiting for a phone call — or perhaps waiting for anything at all to happen — in this tender depiction of how the bonds of friendship are a source of strength in the face of harsh realities.
cast: Desmond Malakai,  Casta-Troy Cocker-Lemalie

name: Waiting for Hassana
pitch: In 2014, the extremist organization Boko Haram kidnapped 276 teenage girls from a town in northeastern Nigeria. Waiting for Hassana is a harrowing first-person account of one girl’s escape from captivity and a heart-wrenching lament for her closest friend Hassana — one of the many girls still unaccounted for.

name: Wajib
pitch: A father and his estranged son must come together to hand deliver his daughter's wedding invitations to each guest as per local Palestinian custom, in this rousing family drama from Annemarie Jacir (When I Saw You).
cast: Mohammad Bakri,  Saleh Bakri,  Maria Zreik,  Rana Alamuddin

name: Wasteland No.1 - Ardent, Verdant
pitch: Computers meet chlorophyll in Jodie Mack's Wasteland No. 1 - Ardent, Verdant, with its rapid-fire montage of close-up circuit boards and bright, saturated flowers.

name: We Forgot to Break Up
pitch: After a few years absence, Evan unexpectedly returns one night to face his now-famous former bandmates. The surprise reunion is bittersweet, in this intimate depiction of the knotty complexities of relating to old friends after everything has changed.
cast: Sofia Banzhaf,  Cara Gee,  Grace Glowicki,  Steven McCarthy,  Mark Rendall,  Dov Tiefenbach,  Jesse Todd

name: We Love Moses
pitch: Twelve-year-old Ella has a crush on her brother’s best friend Moses, but uncovers a secret that changes the game for everyone involved. We Love Moses is an electrifying portrayal of how navigating the complexities of sex and power in girlhood is so inexplicable to parents and often requires taking matters into your own hands.
cast: Danaë Jean-Marie,  Raphel Famotibe,  Jerome Holder,  Paige Cowan Hall,  Kerri McLean,  Claire Redcliffe

name: Western
pitch: Cultural difference, masculine bravado, and national pride lead to high tensions in the latest from Valeska Grisebach, about a group of German construction workers labouring in the Bulgarian countryside.
producers: Valeska Grisebach,  Jonas Dornbach,  Janine Jackowski,  Maren Ade,  Michel Merkt
cast: Meinhard Neumann,  Reinhardt Wetrek,  Syuleyman Alilov Letifov,  Veneta Frangova,  Vyara Borisova

name: What Will People Say
pitch: Nisha’s double life — obedient to her traditional Pakistani upbringing at home, typical Norwegian teenager to her friends — comes crashing down when her concerned parents kidnap her and send her to Pakistan, in Iram Haq’s empathetic story of family, community, and culture.
cast: Maria Mozhdah,  Adil Hussain,  Rohit Saraf,  Ali Arfan,  Sheeba Chaddha,  Lalit Parimoo

name: Who We Are Now
pitch: An ex-con (Julianne Nicholson) forms an unlikely alliance with an idealistic lawyer (Emma Roberts) to regain custody of her young son, in this affecting drama from writer-director Matthew Newton (From Nowhere).
producers: Kate Ballen,  Matthew Newton,  Varun Monga,  Ray Bouderau,  Julianne Nicholson
cast: Julianne Nicholson,  Emma Roberts,  Zachary Quinto,  Jimmy Smits,  Lea Thompson,  Jason Biggs,  Jess Weixler

name: Wicked Girl
pitch: Inspired by a true story, this stunning prizewinner at the Annecy animation festival depicts the free flow of emotions, ideas and images as its eight-year-old narrator recalls her days in her grandparents’ village in Turkey. Though initially scattered, the memories eventually coalesce into a narrative that’s almost too tragic to bear.
cast: Zeynep Naz Daldal

name: Woman Walks Ahead
pitch: Jessica Chastain stars in the true story of Catherine Weldon, a 19th-century Brooklyn artist who travelled to the Dakota Territory and became the confidante of legendary Sioux chief Sitting Bull.
producers: Edward Zwick,  Marshall Herskovitz,  Erika Olde,  Richard Solomon,  Andrea Calderwood
cast: Jessica Chastain,  Michael Greyeyes,  Ciarán Hinds,  Sam Rockwell

name: Yeti
pitch: Polish artist Wojciech Bakowski abandons his refined pencil drawings for a mixture of lo-fi video and computer animation. Images of phones, loafers, and surveillance devices hover and float, yet despite the means of circulation and communication, the artist's body remains near-immobile.
cast: Wojciech Bakowski

name: You Disappear
pitch: Several of Denmark’s finest actors, including Trine Dyrholm (The Commune) and Nikolaj Lie Kaas (Men & Chicken) star in this incisive, sometimes chilling drama about a school principal whose marriage begins to unravel after he receives a terminal diagnosis.

name: Youth
pitch: Set in a military art troupe in 1970s China, Feng Xiaogang’s latest is a coming-of-age story about young people making peace with the past and making the most of the present.

name: Zama
pitch: Tired of waiting for the King to transfer him to a more liberating location, a South American officer of the Spanish Crown embarks on a perilous journey towards freedom, in the latest from Argentinian filmmaker Lucrecia Martel (The Holy Girl, The Headless Woman).

name: below-above
pitch: A disorienting and hypnotic work that renders the natural world at once familiar and alien, André Lehmann's below-above is a staccato montage of trees, rocks, and water, alternating between both sides of real and imagined horizons.

name: homer_b
pitch: From some of Winnipeg’s weirdest minds comes a nightmarish vision that seems to have leaked out from the darkest recesses of Matt Groening’s subconscious and then been somehow preserved on the world’s last VHS cassette. Just who is this clown behind the microphone stand and what does he want?

name: mother!
pitch: Jennifer Lawrence, Javier Bardem, Ed Harris, and Michelle Pfeiffer star in Darren Aronofsky's highly anticipated psychological thriller about a couple threatened by the arrival of univited guests to their tranquil home.
cast: Jennifer Lawrence,  Javier Bardem,  Ed Harris,  Michelle Pfeiffer,  Domhnall Gleeson,  Brian Gleeson,  Kristen Wiig

name: some cities
pitch: some cities is an enchanting miniature and a choreographed performance that playfully returns cinema to its original and intrinsic quality: the artistic manipulation of light.
